comments.body: I don't know if I have any way to get that value
How about using the GroupName variable? https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/apis/authentication/register.go#L26
I don't think I have access to the *value* of that variable unless I parse the source into an AST (e.g. https://gist.github.com/ncdc/fef1099f54a655f8fb11daf86f7868b8)

You are right. I double checked the client-gen code, it uses the full group name [here](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/client/clientset_generated/release_1_5/typed/authentication/v1beta1/authentication_client.go#L71), and it's parsed from a tag [here](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/cmd/libs/go2idl/client-gen/generators/generator_for_group.go#L83-L85), the tag is defined [here](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/apis/authentication/v1beta1/doc.go#L19). The mechanism looks quite hacky though.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +74,78 @@		return &genericInformer{resource: resource.GroupResource(), informer: f.Apps().InternalVersion().StatefulSets().Informer()}, nil

		// Group=Apps, Version=V1beta1
	case v1beta1.SchemeGroupVersion.WithResource("statefulsets"):
		return &genericInformer{resource: resource.GroupResource(), informer: f.Apps().V1beta1().StatefulSets().Informer()}, nil
